title: Overview
content: Slayer is one of the most important skills for Ironmen. It gates access to many BiS weapons (abyssal whip, whip vine, hexcrest, Focus sight), provides a steady flow of combat supplies (herbs, ores, gems), and gives consistent combat XP alongside Slayer XP.
Always use the highest-tier Slayer master your combat level allows. The better the master, the better the tasks, drops, and Slayer XP per hour.

title: Choosing Your Slayer Master
content: Unlock higher-tier masters as your combat level grows. Higher masters offer better tasks and more Slayer points per assignment.
- Turael (Burthorpe): Combat level 3 — use only to skip bad tasks from other masters
- Mazchna (Morytania): Combat level 20 — beginner assignments
- Vannaka (Edgeville Dungeon): Combat level 40 — useful early tasks
- Chaeldar (Lost City): Combat level 75 — requires Lost City quest; good mid-level tasks
- Sumona (Pollnivneach): Combat level 90 — requires Smoking Kills quest
- Kuradal (Ancient Cavern): Combat level 110 — excellent high-value tasks; recommended from 110+
- Morvran (Prifddinas): Combat level 120 — best tasks; requires Plague's End

title: Points Management
content: Slayer points are crucial for Ironmen. Earn them by completing tasks (bonus points every 10th, 50th, 100th, 250th, and 1000th task).
Priority unlocks for Ironmen:
- Broader Fletching: Allows crafting broad bolts — essential for Fletching and Ranged training
- Slayer Helmet (components): Purchase Hexcrest, Focus Sight, and Black mask upgrades
- Block list: Block low-value tasks (e.g., Banshees, Desert Lizards, Cave Bugs) permanently
- Extend list: Extend high-value tasks (e.g., Abyssal Demons, Gargoyles, Nechryaels)
- Turael skip: Use Turael to skip one bad task per day at the cost of resetting your streak

title: Recommended Tasks for Ironmen
content: These tasks offer high XP and drops essential for an Ironman account:
- Abyssal Demons (level 85 Slayer): Abyssal whip, orb, and wand — core mid-game weapons
- Gargoyles (level 75 Slayer): Consistent herb, ore, and gem drops; granite maul
- Nechryaels (level 80 Slayer): Excellent herb drop table — invaluable for Herblore training
- Dark Beasts (level 90 Slayer): Dark bow, death talisman; decent combat XP
- Automatons (level 67 Slayer): Chance at Pneumatic gloves, Tracking gloves, Sparkling gloves
- Glacors (level 96 Slayer): Glacyte boots, armadyl battlestaff components
- Airuts (level 92 Slayer): Strong combat XP, useful charm drops

title: Bossing as Slayer Tasks
content: Assigning bosses as Slayer tasks (unlocked via Slayer points) grants bonus Slayer XP and is highly recommended for Ironmen.
- GWD1 Bosses (Bandos, Armadyl, Saradomin, Zamorak): Great mid-game boss tasks for armour pieces
- Araxxor/Araxxi (level 92 Slayer): Spider silk and Noxious weapons; high Slayer XP
- Kalphite King: Drygore weapons; requires 80+ combat and a good understanding of the fight
- Vorago: Group boss; log book items and seismic weapons
Boss Slayer tasks offer significantly higher XP per hour than regular tasks at endgame.

title: Useful Items and Unlocks
content: Key items every Ironman Slayer trainer should prioritise:
- Full Slayer Helmet: Combines Black mask, Hexcrest, and Focus Sight; +15% melee and +12.5% range/magic damage on task
- Enchanted gem: Free teleports to Slayer masters after purchasing the unlock
- Herbicide: Automatically destroys herbs for passive XP — useful on herb-heavy tasks
- Bonecrusher: Auto-buries bones for passive Prayer XP; combine with Demon horn necklace for Prayer restoration
- Aggression potion: Forces nearby monsters to attack you — great for semi-AFK tasks
- Sign of the Porter: Automatically banks common drops during tasks — extremely valuable for Ironmen
